attributes.action: End UK Export Finance's loans and financial guarantees to fossil fuel projects.
attributes.background:
UK Export Finance offers loans and financial guarantees.
Between 2013 and 2020 it invested £6bn in fossil fuel projects.
UK support to the oil and gas industry has to end if we are to address global climate change. We are asking the UK government to change its policy on this issue immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change is the most significant strategic threat to our wellbeing, both nationally and globally.  There is no doubt that the extraction and burning of fossil fuels has been a significant cause. Given what we know about the situation, continuing to invest in the oil and gas industry when we should be transitioning to sustainable energy sources is madness. 
The UK government should seize the opportunity to become a world leader in developing sustainable energy solutions instead.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317933

attributes.action: Hold an urgent meeting on climate change. Ban meat that isn’t reliably sourced.
attributes.background: We’re requesting an emergency meeting on climate change and a massive reduction in meat consumption, and to only stock meat which is reliably sourced and has no carbon footprint. We are in the midst of a climate emergency and drastic action needs to be taken right now.
attributes.additional_details: We have just 7 years until there is no turning back from this. Droughts, fires, starvation will be coming to us if we do not turn this around right now. There is a climate emergency and no one is addressing this in parliament. Young people do not stand a chance unless you start to do something drastic to address this immediately. We need to ban plastic, half consumption of meat and only buy from small reliable farms and start doing some work to rectify deforestation.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Take action to end factory farming and reduce meat and dairy consumption: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330298

Reform food, energy, environmental and fishing policy to save the planet: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554376

Hold a referendum to decide if the UK should commit to Carbon Neutrality by 2030: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549900

attributes.action: Make 'A Life On Our Planet' Mandatory to watch in all schools in the UK.
attributes.background: Ask government education officials to add David Attenborough's 'A Life On Our Planet' to the curriculums of all UK schools and encourage this at higher level education as well.
attributes.additional_details: A Life On Our Planet outlines clearly and concisely the biggest threats to our life on this planet as well as what we can do on an individual level to help combat this. The film explains the basics of climate change and how they have affected the wild world. These are things of which we should all be aware; not enough of us are. People need to be educated on these issues and how pressing they are in a way that will inspire them to act and change their ways. The Earth needs saving.

rejection.details:
The Government sets a national curriculum of the subject matter schools need to cover, but the educational materials used to teach school students is a matter for individual schools, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a Climate Change subject to the National School Curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318835

attributes.action: Pass the Attenborough act. The banning of the use of fossil fuels.
attributes.background: Whilst there is already so much being done, more can be done and all it takes is a country with power and influence over the world. England can do this and whilst in the current economic climate it is not easy, there can still be a start towards a change like this.
attributes.additional_details: There is no other way in which a change to this scale can be carried out. It has to be a national decision with the full power of the government.

rejection.details:
We understand you want fossil fuels to be banned, but it is not clear whether you want this ban to apply to the production of fossil fuels in the UK, to products which are manufactured using fossil fuels, or to vehicles and other machinery which are powered by fossil fuels. 

You may be interested to know that the Government has recently held a consultation on proposals to end the sale of all petrol, diesel and hybrid cars and vans by 2035 at the latest. The results of the consultation will be published in due course: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/consulting-on-ending-the-sale-of-new-petrol-diesel-and-hybrid-cars-and-vans.

attributes.action: Impose a tax on plastic packaging
attributes.background:
I would like the government to impose a tax on plastic packaging for all industries.
If companies are actively discouraged from using plastic packaging it will encourage them to source sustainable and eco friendly alternatives, something that they are not currently doing with any urgency.
attributes.additional_details:
We are faced with a climate emergency and plastic is playing a huge role in this. We can all do personal things to help change this, but unless large corporations are encouraged to source alternatives to plastic, the change will not be fast enough to reduce the impacts of global warming and the millions of plastic items that end up in our seas each year. 
This tax, just like the charge on carrier bags to the public, could fast track us into the change needed to help solve our climate crisis.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum Legalising the Recreational use of Cannabis for Adults Over 21
attributes.background: Cannabis has been used by humans for thousands of years and has been a necessity in some cultures and religions. As a matter of fact, the body and brain both contain cannabinoid receptors, therefore further highlighting that Cannabis has been part of human culture for thousands of years.
attributes.additional_details:
The government is under heavy debt due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. The government can reduce the amount of debt by taxing Cannabis as it has estimated that this could generate upwards of £3BILLION from the taxation of Cannabis alone.  
Legalising Cannabis would encourage more people to germinate the Cannabis plant. This would make a huge impact on the reduction of climate change due to photosynthesis.
It is time to let the British people choose what they want, not what the government wants

attributes.action: Impose import taxes on clothing imported from low- and middle-income countries.
attributes.background: Fast fashion is destroying the planet and exploiting workers. Fast fashion retailers such as Boohoo and Missguided are contributing to global warming, with synthetic fibre emissions becoming as high as those of fossil fuels. Workers are treated terribly, with very low wages and very long hours.
attributes.additional_details: We are in the midst of a climate emergency, and fast fashion is not helping. Amid the Covid-19 outbreak, fast fashion has slowed down and now is the time to implement changes to slow it down for good. This is important to help our planet, and to help the workers who are exploited by fast fashion companies. It goes against human rights to continue to allow fast fashion to continue at the rate it is at. Implementing import taxes will allow these issues to slow down, helping our planet and workers.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Government already imposes tariffs on the imports of many clothes from outside of the EU.
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.background: Make cemeteries into graveyard forests so that the dead can live on in living trees.
attributes.additional_details: Because there is a tree shortage and a climate problem and I think if all the graveyards were changed into controlled wooded areas, contributing oxygen and taking carbon from our atmosphere, I think this would help stop climate change or even hinder it, this will help contribute oxygen to the atmosphere and our human race!

rejection.details: The Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the upkeep of graveyards. This is a matter for the landowners.

attributes.action: Support the vunerable group, imigrants, in UK!
attributes.background: I have addressed the Prime Minister, Mr Johnson, with a letter asking  Him and His Government to take into consideration and grand an amnesty for this target group.
attributes.additional_details: In the current climate of uncertainty there is high likelihood of job losses, real danger to life and international economy, all of which will trigger many changes in the lives of people and business as we have not known before. From the humanitarian angle, the plight of illegal immigrants currently living in UK, in hiding or otherwise, puts them in the high risk category the most vulnerable group. There are many reasons, in many cases legitimate, why they are here and why they cannot go back.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to take action to support immigrants during the coronavirus outbreak, but we can only accept petitions that make a clear request for a specific action from the Government.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Help Asylum Seekers in UK during the Covid-19 Outbreak: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311322

Create an earned amnesty route for migrants without leave to remain: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301696

Stop All UK Deportation Activity during this Corona Virus Pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310313

If there is an action you would like the Government to take that is not covered by the above, you could start a new petition requesting this.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
 
Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Introduce a right to work from home for office/i.t. staff to help our country
attributes.background: Introduce the right for office staff, I.T workers and anyone who can work from home, to be able to do so, if they choose to, for up-to 3 days a week without needing justification and without any form of penalisation from employers.
attributes.additional_details:
This low cost change offers many quick win benefits including

Less traffic on our roads, easing the demands on our transport network.
Less pollution, aiding the fight against climate change.
More time to care for elderly relatives.
More time to care for children and cut childcare costs.

A healthier society: Freeing up time to take more exercise, helping us cut down on obesity and improve mental health too.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301439

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
 
Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Do not neglect climate change efforts during coronavirus economic recession
attributes.background: Coronavirus is affecting hundreds of thousands globally and causing many personal tragedies. It also looks likely to cause a global financial recession. But global decarbonization efforts MUST continue with the same, and more, intensity as before. Please do not reduce climate change investment!
attributes.additional_details: Coronvirus is rightly attracting the world governments' full attention and the world's economy must be protected. But when this is over, we must be extremely careful to continue to invest in carbon neutral/carbon negative initiatives and NOT lock in fossil fuel investments as a knee-jerk reaction to fixing the economy after the epidemic. We must think long term - decarbonization is just as vital as before to protect our Earth and our children. Please sign to support.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300000

attributes.action: For Environmental awareness to be made compulsory and a module within Schools
attributes.background: For all schools to apply a core module from early years on the Environment encouraging awareness and action. It can be a fundamental initiative which encourages young people to engage in their environment by being educated on climate change fit for each school year.
attributes.additional_details: Environmental education is essential to ensure our future generations apply the measures required to preserve our environment. Bringing nature to the classroom is imperative to highlight to school children (and parents indirectly) the need for change. Environmental awareness and nature should be on a par with key classes in all schools. It is essential that children grow up with a great understanding, education in current issues and knowledge on what actions to take to protect earth.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300279

attributes.action: end all unessential travel for business reasons and make use of online meetings
attributes.background: By ending unessential travel for business purposes and replacing it with virtual communication, there is a higher likelihood that there can be enforced behavioural changes that will continue to alleviate the climate emergency (as has been seen through flight restrictions given in light of COVID-19).
attributes.additional_details:
In light of Coronavirus, it is apparent that the government CAN put forward immediate policies that protect the nations health, such as the restriction of 1000’s of flights.
These restrictions have already proven to be effective in the alleviation of CO2 levels. 
By ending all travel for business endeavours and replacing it travel with virtual meetings, (as being seen currently) the government stands a chance of protecting its citizens against the much bigger threat of the climate crisis.

rejection.details:
Decisions bout business travel are a matter for individual companies and business people, and not the Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition calling for the Government to bring forward legislation reducing number of flights which are allowed, or increasing taxes for flights, if you would like that to happen.

attributes.action: Plant coral forests and save existing coral forests.
attributes.background:
Coral reefs are dying around the world. Damaging activities include coral mining, pollution, overfishing, blast fishing, the digging of canals and access into islands and bays. Climate change, such as warming temperatures, causes coral bleaching, which if severe kills the coral.
STOP THIS!!!!
attributes.additional_details: Coral trees absorb 4 times as much carbon dioxide as trees do!!! This means that coral forests are 4 times more valuable than forests.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly whether you want the UK Government to fund the creation of coral reefs in UK waters, or to support global efforts to increase coral reefs. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
